episodeTitle: The Missing Pirate Ship! 2nd Round Assault on the Fortress
episodeTitleJapanese: 消えた海賊船！要塞攻防第2ラウンド
episodeTitleRomanized: Kieta kaizokusen! Yōsai kōbō Dai ni Raundo
description: The Straw Hats disguise the Going Merry as a Marine vessel to retrieve their confiscated Skypiea treasure from G-8 base. Nami navigates using ship bells while Robin identifies safe docking locations. The crew reflects on their memories with the Merry and makes a crucial decision to hire a shipwright.

events.title: Luffy Proposes Hiding Among Navy Ships
events.description: Luffy seriously suggests disguising the Going Merry and hiding it among other Navy vessels at G-8 base. The crew agrees this is their best strategy to recover their treasure and escape.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's strategic thinking and sets up the main plot of the episode. This disguise plan becomes central to the crew's infiltration strategy.

quotes.text: Let's hide the ship among the other Navy ships so they won't notice it!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Usopp Disguises the Going Merry
events.description: Usopp uses scrap materials and junk found in the dock to transform the Going Merry's appearance into a convincing Marine vessel, complete with fake cannons and naval insignia.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's craftsman skills and creativity. This disguise is crucial for the crew's infiltration plan and shows his value to the crew beyond combat.

events.title: Nami's Navigation by Sound
events.description: Nami uses her exceptional navigation skills to guide the Going Merry through the fog by listening to the bells of Navy ships, calculating their positions to avoid detection.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's navigational expertise and sensory abilities. Her skills allow the crew to move undetected through the heavily patrolled waters of G-8.

quotes.text: I can use the sounds of the Navy ship bells to detect where they are so the Going Merry can sail around them without crashing.
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Robin Identifies Safe Docking Location
events.description: Robin uses her knowledge and observation to identify empty docks within the G-8 base, explaining that budget constraints have left certain areas unmanned and perfect for hiding the Merry.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's intelligence and analytical abilities. Her insight provides the crew with a safe haven within enemy territory.

events.title: Crew Decides to Hire a Shipwright
events.description: After reflecting on all their adventures with the Going Merry, the Straw Hats make a crucial decision to allocate 80% of their Skypiea gold toward hiring a professional shipwright. They acknowledge that while Usopp has done his best, the Merry needs expert repairs.
events.significance: This is a CANON scene from Chapter 303. This decision directly sets up the Water 7 arc and the eventual recruitment of Franky. It shows the crew's maturity in recognizing their limitations and the importance of properly maintaining their ship.

quotes.text: We should save 80% to pay a shipwright to repair the Going Merry properly.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Proposing budget allocation for ship repairs

quotes.text: I'm a sniper, not a shipwright. The Merry deserves someone who really knows what they're doing.
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Acknowledging his limitations in ship repair

events.title: Flashback: Usopp Joins the Crew
events.description: The crew reminisces about the moment Usopp was invited to set sail with them aboard the Going Merry, leaving his village behind to pursue adventure.
events.significance: Reinforces the emotional bond between the crew and their ship. These flashbacks build toward the eventual emotional weight of the Merry's fate in Water 7.

events.title: Flashback: Nami's Departure from Home
events.description: The crew recalls Nami officially joining them and leaving her home village aboard the Going Merry after the defeat of Arlong.
events.significance: Highlights the Going Merry as the vessel that represents freedom and new beginnings for each crew member. Emphasizes Nami's journey from prisoner to free pirate.

events.title: Flashback: Sailing Up Reverse Mountain
events.description: The crew remembers their thrilling entry into the Grand Line aboard the Going Merry, successfully navigating the dangerous Reverse Mountain.
events.significance: Commemorates one of the Going Merry's greatest achievements and the crew's official entry into the Grand Line. Shows how far they've come together.

events.title: Flashback: Entering Skypiea
events.description: The crew fondly recalls the Going Merry's incredible journey riding the Knock Up Stream to reach the Sky Island of Skypiea.
events.significance: Highlights one of the Going Merry's most impossible feats, emphasizing the ship's resilience and the crew's trust in their vessel through impossible odds.

events.title: Crew Splits Into Two Teams
events.description: The Straw Hats divide into two groups: one team will recover the confiscated Skypiea treasure while the other will retrieve Nami's Waver from the base.
events.significance: Sets up the action sequences for the following episodes. Shows the crew's ability to coordinate complex multi-objective operations.

events.title: Jonathan's Strategic Planning
events.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan continues to anticipate the Straw Hats' moves, demonstrating his exceptional tactical mind. He has already prepared for their attempt to reclaim their treasure.
events.significance: Establishes Jonathan as a formidable non-combat antagonist who relies on intelligence over brute force. Shows that the Marines can be clever and strategic opponents.

quotes.text: Let's hide the ship among the other Navy ships so they won't notice it!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Proposing the disguise strategy to infiltrate G-8

quotes.text: I can use the sounds of the Navy ship bells to detect where they are so the Going Merry can sail around them without crashing.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Explaining her navigation technique in the fog

quotes.text: We should save 80% to pay a shipwright to repair the Going Merry properly.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Discussing how to allocate their Skypiea treasure

quotes.text: I'm a sniper, not a shipwright. The Merry deserves someone who really knows what they're doing.
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Acknowledging the need for a professional shipwright

themes.description: The episode focuses heavily on the crew's emotional connection to the Going Merry through flashbacks, highlighting their shared memories and adventures.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry represents more than just transportation—it's their home, witness to their journey, and a crew member in spirit.

themes.description: The crew's decision to hire a professional shipwright shows their maturity and recognition that love alone isn't enough—proper care requires expertise.
themes.symbolism: Acknowledging limitations and seeking help represents the crew's evolution from amateur pirates to serious adventurers.

themes.description: Both the Straw Hats and Jonathan rely on clever tactics, disguises, and planning rather than direct confrontation.
themes.symbolism: The disguised Merry represents the power of deception and intelligence in achieving goals.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates her exceptional navigation skills and financial planning, guiding the crew both literally and figuratively.
quotes: I can use the sounds of the Navy ship bells to detect where they are so the Going Merry can sail around them without crashing.
We should save 80% to pay a shipwright to repair the Going Merry properly.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows both his craftsmanship in disguising the Merry and his maturity in acknowledging the need for a real shipwright.
keyActions: Creates convincing Marine disguise for Going Merry
Acknowledges his limitations as a shipwright
quotes: I'm a sniper, not a shipwright. The Merry deserves someone who really knows what they're doing.

characterSpotlights.development: Uses her knowledge and observation to identify strategic opportunities for the crew.
keyActions: Identifies empty docks due to budget constraints

characterSpotlights.development: Shows unexpected strategic thinking by proposing the disguise plan, demonstrating growth beyond his usual impulsive nature.
quotes: Let's hide the ship among the other Navy ships so they won't notice it!

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 203 contains a canon scene from Chapter 303 (approximately 13:00-20:00) where the crew discusses hiring a shipwright and allocating 80% of their gold for ship repairs. The rest of the episode is anime-original filler content.
The entire G-8 Arc (episodes 196-206) is anime-original filler that doesn't appear in the manga. The Straw Hats go directly from Skypiea to Long Ring Long Land in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 203 is unique because it's part of a filler arc but contains a canon scene from Chapter 303 about hiring a shipwright, seamlessly blending filler and canon content.
The G-8 Arc is widely considered the best filler arc in One Piece history, with many fans wishing it was canon.

sources.title: One Piece: The 10 Best Filler Episodes, Ranked

trivia.fact: Vice Admiral Jonathan is one of the few antagonists that Luffy never directly fought, showcasing a different type of conflict based on strategy rather than combat.
The flashbacks to the Going Merry's adventures in this episode serve as foreshadowing for the emotional arc that will culminate in the Merry's farewell during the Water 7 arc.
